name: 錢膺仁
objective:
This course provides an in-depth study of digital signal processing (DSP) principles and techniques. Some ideas are built using MATLAB codes. Topics include discrete-time signals and systems, Fourier analysis, Z-transform, filter design and implementation, sampling rate conversion, random signal processing, and spectral analysis. The course emphasizes both theoretical foundations and practical applications through assignments, projects, and research paper studies. By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. Analyze and process discrete-time signals and systems.
2. Apply the Fourier and Z-transform techniques to signal analysis.
3. Design and implement FIR and IIR digital filters.
4. Perform spectral analysis and sampling rate conversion.
5. Critically review and present recent research papers in DSP.
6. Complete a comprehensive final project demonstrating mastery of course concepts.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Discrete-Time Signals and Systems
Week 3: Discrete-Time Fourier Analysis 
Week 4: Z-Transform
Week 5-6: Discrete Fourier Transform
Week 7-8: Implementation of Discrete-Time Filter
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: FIR Filter Design
Week 11: IIR Filter Design
Week 12: Sampling Rate Conversion
Week 13:  Random Signal Processing
Week 14-15 Spectral Analysis Techniques
Week 16-17 Paper Study
Week 18: Final Project Presentation
scorePolicy:
Attendance 10%
Midterm 30%
Final Project Reports 30%
Final Project Presentations 30%
materials:
1. Digital Digital signal processing using MATLAB V.4 / Vinay K. Ingle, John G. Proakis. (1997)
2. Applied digital signal processing : theory and practice / Dimitris G. Manolakis, Vinay K. Ingle.(2012)
